text: A ball with charge − 50e is placed at the centre of a hollow spherical shell having a charge of − 50e. What is the charge on the shell’s outer surface?
hint: Let the induced charge on inner surface and outer surface is <math><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> respectively, then  <math><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>+ <math><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> = −50e. Here, charge <math><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1 </mn></msub></math>induced due to ball is + 50e. So, +50e + <math><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> = -50e ⇒ <math><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> = -100e
